text: The only original soundtrack I bought back in the day. (There wasn't much choice where I live.) This track will always be a favorite of mine. And the game was indeed the best of the lot.

text: Definitely up there with my favorite ending credits themes in video games.

author: Dr. Saib

text: I think this is the only game I've ever played where the end credits were a profoundly emotional experience.  this song combined with the different shots of Nede and Expel... such a sense of closure.  This game is a masterpiece.
author: archaist

text: Can't believe the entire sequence (and thus, music) was removed in the PSP remake, in favor of that terrible J-Pop song ! At least you can find it in the Music Test (without the video...) after beating the game, but still...

text: archaist  fu**ing agreed

text: Well, for Claude, I think they were trying to get a voice that was closer to Ilia's and Ronyx's voice actors from the SO1 remake. The others.... They smoked too much weed? I dunno.

text: Such a beautiful ending. The game is one thing, but this song takes you on a journey of it's very own~

text: @calvinsora101 Yeah, that was in 1997 or whenever Star Ocean 2 came out in the U.S. I'm glad they retranslated the names back to original.
author: Raimundo91

text: @calvinsora101 Yeah, but that was in 1996. I'm glad they translated the names back into English.
author: Raimundo91

text: @calvinsora101 Because in the original Japanese version, that was their names. Indalecio was Gabriel. They changed it in the original American version for censorship reasons.
